_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan Executive Summary

Facility:Trotter Fertilizer
City:Ansley, NE
Contact:Lyle Lovitt
Phone:308-935-1102


1.Faciltiy Policy.

    The owners, management, and employees of Trotter Fertilizer are committed to prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, Custer County LEPC and other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to persons and the environment.

2.Facility Information.

    Trotter Fertilizer is a small independent retail facility of plant food and crop protection chemicals. Crop nutrients in a clean, easily absorable form are mixed, sold and delivered. Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored, and distributed for direct application to the farm. The maximum quantity stored would be 260000 pounds in a storage tank and nurse facility.

3.Accidental Release Prevention Program.

    This faciltiy is in compliance with the provisions of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia K-61.1", published by The American National Standards Institute, In.,(ANSI), and the Standards of the U.S.Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910,111, "Storage and Registration Form, see Section 8.3 (b).

4.Five-year Accidental History.

    There have been no reportable accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the last five year.

5.Emergency Response Program.

    The facility has:
                    a.A written action plan, in accordance with OSHA standard 29 CFR 1910.38.

                    b.Provided state and local authorities with the emergency planning and community right-to-know information as requird under SARA III (EPCRA).

6.Planned Changes to Improve Safety.

    Safety improvements are an on-going process at this facility. Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the maintenance and safe conditions of our equipment. There are no additional specifi

c anhydrous ammonia safety recommendations at this time.

7.For futher information contact: Lyle Lovitt at 308-935-1100
